We are all Indians with a common and related civilizational heritage from languages ​​to food to way marriages and ceremonies are conducted, gods and beliefs, our daily lifestyles. Local flavors will always be distinct due to variations of local factors when spread over such a large area, population and timescale. Let us remind ourselves of that and stand for those who give preference to this heritage and commonality to be united against a fractured world. Only we are the last remaining spot of competition and confluence and have been so from the distant past. I urge people to realize that and give it preference over everything else. Dictatorship is better for us compared to democracy.
 
 Democracy never works! It's a weak system of governance. You cannot have democracy all the time. Sometimes, you have to make bold decisions for which you cannot use democracy. You MUST use dictatorial means. Western-style democracy simply cannot work in India because Indians in general are different people. For democracy to work efficiently, people must be enlightened and disciplined, which Indians in general are not. So, to keep people in line, autocracy or dictatorship is needed.
 
 Another problem with democracy is that the governance can never become mature because it keeps on changing after every 5â€“10 years. We need to get rid of democracy and only have one single government and allow that government to mature a bit. It normally takes 15Ã¢â‚¬â€œ20 years for a government to start maturing. You need real professionals to run a government and not immature and emotional people who are unintelligent and make sectarian remarks to get some leverage and influence.
 
 In dictatorship, there's no opposition which means no obstacles. Your governance and its procedures can run seamlessly. The government can easily make bold decisions and things get done a lot faster in a dictatorship plus there are less or no political fights. Everyone agrees to one thing and no time gets wasted in useless quarrels thereby accelerating decision-making and spurring developmental work.
 
 Democracy is also not safe for India. We must try to minimize democracy and maximize autocracy. And by the way, democracy is defined by international rule-based order controlled by America.
 
 Giving up on personal freedoms and yet living a fulfilled life is way better than living a life of freedom that comes with dissatisfaction and poverty.
